content: Malaysian-born Singaporean politicianThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Ang Mong Seng" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(September 2025)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Ang Mong Seng** [PBM](/wiki/Pingat_Bakti_Masyarakat), [BBM](/wiki/Bintang_Bakti_Masyarakat) ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 洪茂诚; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Hóng Màochéng*; born 30 September 1949) is a Malaysian-born Singaporean former politician. A former member of the governing [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP), he was the [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore#Members_of_Parliament) (MP) for [Bukit Gombak Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Gombak_Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC) between 1997 and 2001 and the Bukit Gombak division of [Hong Kah Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Hong_Kah_Group_Representation_Constituency) (GRC) between 2001 and 2011. ## Career Ang graduated from the former [Nanyang University](/wiki/Nanyang_University) and worked at the [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) during the 1970s. By 1988 he had worked his way up the ranks to become General Manager of Bukit Panjang and later Sembawang Town Councils. ### Political career In the [2006 general elections](/wiki/2006_Singapore_general_election), the PAP had a walkover in Hong Kah GRC. In the [2001 general elections](/wiki/2001_Singapore_general_election), the PAP defeated the [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party) with 79.74% of the votes for Hong Kah GRC. Prior to his stint in Hong Kah GRC, Ang represented [Bukit Gombak](/wiki/Bukit_Gombak) SMC from 1997 to 2001 where he defeated [Ling How Doong](/wiki/Ling_How_Doong) from [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party) and a third candidate from the [Singapore People's Party](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Party) in the [1997 general elections](/wiki/1997_Singaporean_general_election). Until 2011, he has sat on four select committees in Parliament. Ang retired from politics prior to the [2011 general elections](/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election), and [Bukit Gombak](/wiki/Bukit_Gombak) ward was absorbed into the newly created [Chua Chu Kang GRC](/wiki/Chua_Chu_Kang_GRC) while Hong Kah GRC was dissolved. This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Ang Mong Seng
